context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and authorize orders within the order management system.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: Enable managers to review and authorize orders to progress business workflow.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved and processed for fulfillment.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display orders pending approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
The system shall notify relevant parties upon order approval.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the notification process for order approvals.
main_flow: 1. Manager selects an order to approve → System displays order details.
2. Manager reviews the order details → System allows manager to approve or reject the order.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates order status to approved and notifies relevant parties.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the order details are incomplete, then the system prompts the manager to complete the required information.
